other_tests.findings: Inlet patch involving the circumference of the cervical esophagus, multiple erosions of the gastric antrum, antral gastritis, superficial ulcerations in the duodenum, and a prominent mucosal fold in the gastric side of the gastroesophageal junction.
Several small polyps; pathological examination showed adenomatous changes and low-grade dysplasia in one polyp, a hyperplastic rectal polyp, and normal fragments of duodenal mucosa.
Blastocystis hominis found in stool speciment.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Symptoms resolved after treatment with metronidazole.

other_tests.findings: Grade III esophagitis, erosive or exudative circumferential lesions, excessive fluid in the gastric body, a partially obstructing duodenal ulcer, and multiple ulcers in the second part of the duodenum.
Nests of tumor cells with characteristics of neuroendocrine cells; positive for gastrin; classified as a well-differentiated pancreatic neuroendocrine neoplasm (gastrinoma), grade 1.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Serum gastrin levels remained normal after surgery.
